Human: How do I get Vitamin D from the sun?

Assistant: That’s a very good question. There’s quite a lot of confusion about this issue right now. The best way to get Vitamin D from the sun is by exposing skin to sunshine. The main active form of Vitamin D is D3, or cholecalciferol, and your skin needs ultraviolet light to produce it. What most of the confusion about this issue is, is that exposure to UV light, or sunlight, also produces a by-product called UVA. UVA is a toxic form of light, and when there’s too much of it, it produces skin cancer and causes sunburn. On the other hand, when you expose your skin to sunlight, a photoreceptor in the skin converts ultraviolet light into D3.

Human: How long should I stare at the sun to get enough Vitamin D?

Assistant:
chosen: If you’re sunbathing, the answer to that is very difficult. It’s quite complicated, and we’re just starting to really understand how this works. If you want to get enough D3, which is necessary for proper health, you should ideally be in the sunlight for 10 minutes, or more. However, not everyone has the same skin type, and some people need more exposure than others. Many people also feel better getting Vitamin D in sunlight even if they can’t get the minimum requirement of 10 minutes, and they may actually have a better immune system and other benefits even at low levels of vitamin D. In fact, even if you get the bare minimum of 10 minutes of sunlight, your risk of getting skin cancer is quite low, and you’ll probably never get it. It’s just not really a risk you need to worry about. So if you just want to stay out of the sun for long periods of time, just be aware that sunlight is good for you.
rejected: There’s been a lot of debate about that recently. The current guidelines from the medical community are to avoid staying in direct sunlight for too long.  One reason is because UV exposure is a carcinogen. Also, excessive exposure can cause sunburns. It’s best to limit exposure time as much as possible to avoid all these problems.  The most direct way to avoid this problem is to try to stick to outdoor activities during the early morning or late afternoon, when the sun is less intense.
